intro: Isonandra curtisii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers, which come in shades of violet, pink, and white, bloom in clusters and are often used in ornamental gardening. Isonandra curtisii prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
